title: Breakfast Choice Calm-Down
steps: Pause together: 3 deep breaths as a family.
Name the problem in one sentence: “We have different breakfast choices.”
Turn-taking: each child gets 30 seconds to share their choice without interruption.
Reflect back one feeling you heard from each child.
Offer two-win options (rotate choices on alternate days or mix-and-match sides).

title: Feelings First, Fix Later
steps: Ask: “What happened?” then “How did that feel?”
Validate: “It makes sense you feel that way.”
Ask: “What would make this morning easier for you?”
Pick one small step you all agree to try today.

title: Two-Choices Morning Reset
steps: State boundary calmly: “We need to leave in 15 minutes.”
Offer two choices: e.g., “Oats with banana” or “Toast with peanut butter.”
If disagreement continues, use timer for 60 seconds of quiet thinking.
After timer, choose option; appreciate cooperation.
